title: Lauren_Mills published 'Set up textiles hub for Leicester to revive the industry'
text:
'Set up textiles hub for Leicester to revive the industry' By Lauren_Mills   0 COMMENTS SHARES More help planned for Leicester's textiles companies 'Set up textiles hub for Leicester to revive the industry' X

New research suggests a Leicester Textiles and Fashion Hub needs to be set up to help revive one of the city and county's oldest industries. 
The Leicester and Leicestershire Enterprise Partnership (LLEP) carried out a study to establish the need for a physical Leicester Textiles and Fashion Hub. 
The study explored various ways to create a physical textiles and fashion hub to act as a "one-stop shop" for businesses. 
Read more: Council 'concerned' after Leicester textile firms accused of paying below the minimum wage 
Establishing the need for a physical textiles and fashion hub in Leicester was one of the key objectives set out in the Leicester and Leicestershire Textiles Sector Growth Plan, published by LLEP in June 2015. 
In December 2016, the LLEP commissioned Focus Consultants to carry out research and canvas the views of industry leaders on the possibility of a physical hub in Leicester. 
The study, which was part-funded by the LLEP's ERDF Technical Assistance Programme and Leicester City Council, recognises the strengths and weaknesses of the textiles manufacturing sector in Leicester and Leicestershire, and scopes the potential to launch a textiles hub while exploring the possibilities of deliverability, location, size, cost, image, form and function and sustainability. 
Some of the main findings include: 
The sector employs 9,500 jobs in 1,480 businesses. 
UK manufacturing offers important advantages around flexibility and speed. 
Macroeconomic changes such as exchange rates, Brexit and discussions on trade deals are also influencing reshoring of manufacturing back to the UK. 
The textiles sector is much wider than fashion. However, it is clear there is a will and opportunity at this time to address some of the issues facing the fashion textiles sector as a first phase of the Textiles Hub. 
Focus Consulting has also prepared a mission statement for the Hub which is: "To support the development of a robust, future-focused, highly skilled and sustainable fashion and textiles sector with high quality jobs in Leicester and the UK." 
Nick Pulley, chairman of the LLEP, said: "The fashion and textiles sector is very important to the local economy. 
"There is a great passion from industry leaders to pursue a Textiles and Fashion Hub and this textiles report is a fantastic starting point. 
"A Textiles and Fashion Hub would provide opportunities and facilities for research, development, innovation, collaboration with universities, colleges and skills training."
